metadata.title: The gene encoding the nucleocapsid protein: sequence analysis in murine hepatitis virus type 3 and evolution in Coronaviridae

abstract.original_text: The nucleoprotein-encoding gene (N) of murine hepatitis virus type 3 (MHV 3), from the Mill Hilt strain, was cloned and sequenced. It was compared to gene N from other routine coronaviruses and was found to share more similarities with N sequences from MHV 1 and MHV JHM strains than with the published MHV3 N sequence which is almost identical to MHVA59. We suggest that the evolution of some MHV N sequences resulted from a double recombination phenomenon between two ancestors. Furthermore, comparison of protein N from avian and mammalian coronaviruses leads to the hypothesis that horizontal transfer events of the virus from one host species to another have occurred.

sentences.segment_text: The nucleoprotein-encoding gene ( N ) of murine hepatitis virus type 3 ( MHV 3 ) ,
from the Mill Hilt strain , was cloned and sequenced .

It was compared to gene N from other routine coronaviruses and was found to share more similarities with N sequences from MHV 1 and MHV JHM strains than with the published MHV3 N sequence which is almost identical to MHVA59 .
We suggest that the evolution of some MHV N sequences resulted from a double recombination phenomenon between two ancestors .
Furthermore , comparison of protein N from avian and mammalian coronaviruses leads to the hypothesis that horizontal transfer events of the virus from one host species to another have occurred .
